thread.title: Eagles Scouting Report: How Can Birds Stymie Packers Offense?
thread.title_full: Eagles Scouting Report: How Can Birds Stymie Packers Offense?

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Eagles Scouting Report: How Can Birds Stymie Packers Offense?
text:
By Nick Faria ,
2 hours ago After a slow start in 2023, the Green Bay Packers were able to grow into one of the most dominant offenses in the NFL despite fielding the youngest group around the league.
Ken Blaze-Imagn Images
As the Philadelphia Eagles get set to take on this improved Packers offense, they'll do so knowing what worked for the organization last year could be a lot different going into 2024.
With the signing of Josh Jacobs, the Packers are trying to improve the overall potential of their group. It puts pressure on the new Eagles defensive coordinator Vic Fangio to find ways to stop Green Bay's offense when the two teams face off Friday night in Brazil.
Jacobs led the league in rushing two seasons ago but suffered injuries in 2023. He's been the catalyst for the Las Vegas Raiders offense for the last five seasons.
Philadelphia will already have to contend with the likes of Jordan Love and the Packers passing offense, but Jacobs is an entirely different threat on his own.
Related: Eagles vs. Packers: How To Watch Week 1 Showdown in Brazil
Early in 2023, the Eagles were one of the better-rushing teams in the NFL before their untimely collapse down the stretch. If they can force the Packers to become one-dimensional on Friday night, the Eagles could be in a great position to come away with a win on opening night.
